content.SCENARIO: Time for a quick knowledge check! Let's see how well you know the difference between the two most important words in sanitation. Get ready!
content.COSMETOLOGY_CONNECTION: Quickly and confidently knowing the difference between cleaning and disinfecting is a mark of a true professional. This quick quiz will sharpen that instinct.
content.THE_LAW: This quiz validates your understanding of the core definitions of 'Clean' (ยง83.100(2)) and 'Disinfect' (ยง83.100(3)).

questions.question: You wipe down your station to remove all visible hair clippings and product residue. This action is called:
questions.feedback: Correct! 'Cleaning' is the process of removing all visible debris. It's the essential first step.

questions.question: You immerse your metal shears in a liquid that is proven to kill bacteria, viruses, and fungi. This action is called:
questions.feedback: That's right! 'Disinfecting' is the use of a chemical to destroy pathogens. This can only happen after a tool has been cleaned.

questions.question: The fight against the 'invisible enemy' (pathogens) is the primary goal of:
questions.feedback: Exactly! Disinfection is all about eliminating the microscopic pathogens you can't see.

questions.question: If you can SEE it (debris, hair, dust), your job is to _______ it.
questions.feedback: You got it! If it's visible, it needs to be cleaned off before any disinfection can happen.
